I have never done any LISP programming, and wanted to get some experience with it. I decided to go through the book Land of Lisp, doing different programming exercises as I went through it. Land of Lisp doesn't have specific programming exercises, so I did slightly modified versions of the games that were presented in the book.

The github repository where my solutions can be found is located at:
https://github.com/SaintNicholas/Land-of-Lisp
